user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_auth_check_all:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthResult
digest_auth_check_all (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                       const char *realm,
                       const char *username,
                       const char *password,
                       const uint8_t *userdigest,
                       unsigned int nonce_timeout,
                       uint32_t max_nc,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                       enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3)
{
  enum MHD_DigestAuthResult res;
  char *buf;
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;

  buf = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  if (0 == nonce_timeout)
    nonce_timeout = connection->daemon->dauth_def_nonce_timeout;
  if (0 == max_nc)
    max_nc = connection->daemon->dauth_def_max_nc;
  res = digest_auth_check_all_inner (connection, realm, username, password,
                                     userdigest,
                                     nonce_timeout,
                                     max_nc, mqop, malgo3,
                                     &buf, &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf)
    free (buf);

  return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (NULL != buf)
    free (buf);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The branch is reachable: buf is initialized to NULL then passed by address to digest_auth_check_all_inner which may set buf to a non-NULL allocated pointer. If inner allocates, the if (NULL != buf) branch executes and free(buf) runs; if not, the branch is skipped. Both outcomes are possible depending on the inner function, so the code is not unreachable.
